title: Huawei Mate 60
content:

Main lens: 50 million pixels (F1.4-F4.0 aperture, OIS optical image stabilization) supports super optical zoom
Ultra wide angle: 12 million pixels (F2.2 aperture)

Main lens: 50 million pixels (F1.4-F4.0 aperture, OIS optical image stabilization) supports super optical zoom
Ultra wide angle: 12 million pixels (F2. 2 aperture)
Telephoto: 48 million pixels (F3.0 aperture, OIS optical image stabilization) | front_camera = 13 million pixel ultra-wide angle (F2.4 aperture), ToF camera | sound = [[stereo]] | connectivity = [[Wi-Fi]] 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac/ax, 2 × 2 MIMO, HE160, 1024 QAM, 8 Spatial-stream Sounding MU-MIMO
[[Bluetooth]] 5.2, NearLink1.0 ([[Star Flash]]), supports SBC, AAC, supports LDAC and L2HC high-definition audio
USB 3.1 Gen 1 Type-C | other =IP68 dustproof and waterproof, second generation Kunlun glass | sar = | hac = }} The '''Huawei Mate 60 and Mate 60 Pro / Pro+ / RS''' is a high-end 2023 [[smartphone]] product of the Chinese [[Huawei]] corporation from its [[Huawei Mate series]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2023-09-07/huawei-mate-60-pro-draws-sanctions-scrutiny-on-smic-and-china-tech|title=Huawei Is Letting Its Controversial New Phone Speak for Itself|newspaper=Bloomberg |date=September 7, 2023|via=www.bloomberg.com|access-date=2023-09-08|archive-date=2023-09-08|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230908124403/https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2023-09-07/huawei-mate-60-pro-draws-sanctions-scrutiny-on-smic-and-china-tech|url-status=live}} It has a [[HiSilicon#Kirin 9000s|Kirin 9000s]] [[System on a chip|SoC chipset]] designed by [[HiSilicon]] and produced by the [[Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corporation|SMIC]] foundry.{{Cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-09-06/us-seeks-details-on-made-in-china-huawei-chip-as-debate-grows|title=US Wants Details on Made-in-China Huawei Chip|newspaper=Bloomberg |date=September 6, 2023|via=www.bloomberg.com|access-date=2023-09-08|archive-date=2023-09-06|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230906113844/https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-09-06/us-seeks-details-on-made-in-china-huawei-chip-as-debate-grows|url-status=live}} The device supports satellite network communications and [[5G]].{{Cite news |date=2023-09-07 |title=Qualcomm Tumbles After China Turmoil Hits Apple, Huawei Vendors |language=en |work=Bloomberg.com |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-09-07/qualcomm-tumbles-after-china-turmoil-hits-apple-huawei-vendors |access-date=2023-09-08 |archive-date=2023-09-08 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230908061539/https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-09-07/qualcomm-tumbles-after-china-turmoil-hits-apple-huawei-vendors |url-status=live }} ==Technology== === Processors === The Huawei Mate 60 is the first phone to use new Chinese 7-nm microprocessor technology chips that were developed despite the imposition of US sanctions on the company.{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/videos/2023-09-05/a-look-inside-huawei-s-mate-60-pro-phone-video|title=A Look Inside Huawei's Mate 60 Pro Phone|date=September 5, 2023|via=www.bloomberg.com|access-date=2023-09-08|archive-date=2023-09-08|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230908124403/https://www.bloomberg.com/news/videos/2023-09-05/a-look-inside-huawei-s-mate-60-pro-phone-video|url-status=live}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-09-07/huawei-mate-60-pro-phone-gives-ammo-to-biden-doubters-on-china|title=Huawei's Surprise Phone Gives Ammo to Biden Doubters on China|newspaper=Bloomberg |date=September 7, 2023|via=www.bloomberg.com|access-date=2023-09-08|archive-date=2023-09-07|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230907191047/https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-09-07/huawei-mate-60-pro-phone-gives-ammo-to-biden-doubters-on-china|url-status=live}} The CPU HiSilicon Kirin 9000S is a SoC supposed to consist of four high-performance cores (one at up to 2.62 GHz and three at up to 2,150 MHz) that is based on HiSilicon's TaiShan microarchitecture seemingly derived from ARM Neoverse E1) and four energy-efficient cores (up to 1,530 MHz) based on [[ARM Cortex-A510|ARM's Cortex 510]].{{Cite web |author1=Anton Shilov |date=2023-09-03 |title=Huawei's New Mystery 7nm Chip from Chinese Fab Defies US Sanctions |url=https://www.tomshardware.com/news/huaweis-new-mystery-7nm-chip-from-chinese-fab-defies-us-sanctions |access-date=2023-09-13 |website=Tom's Hardware |language=en}} The smartphone also uses the Maleoon 910 graphics processing unit operating at up to 750 MHz. === Network communications === According to third-party testing, although after plugging in the [[SIM card]], the network standard indication of the phone does not show that is's [[5G]], and Huawei does not mention supporting the 5G in the parameter details, the actual network speed test shows that its performance is quite in 5G.{{Cite web |last= |date=2023-08-31 |title=华为Mate 60 Pro之谜：让麒麟飞一会 |url=https://www.huxiu.com/article/1993806.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230831070533/https://www.huxiu.com/article/1993806.html |archive-date=2023-08-31 |access-date=2023-08-31 |website=虎嗅网 |url-status=live}}Reports also believe that it has the ability to support 5G.{{Cite news |last=Murray |first=Warren |date=2023-09-06 |title=China dodges western 5G chip embargo with new Huawei Mate 60 phone |language=en-GB |work=The Guardian |url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/sep/06/huawei-mate-60-pro-mobile-phone-china-dodges-5g-chip-embargo |access-date=2023-09-20 |issn=0261-3077}}{{Cite web |date=2023-09-11 |title=Huawei Mate 60 Pro smartphone hands-on look: world-beating camera, OK chip |url=https://www.scmp.com/lifestyle/gadgets/article/3234080/huawei-mate-60-pro-smartphone-first-impressions-world-beating-camera-good-enough-chip-no-google-apps |access-date=2023-09-20 |website=South China Morning Post |language=en}} On the contrary, Huawei focuses more on promoting its capabilities as a satellite communication terminal. The Mate 60 series smartphone supports satellite call functions through the [[Tiantong (Satellite)|Tiantong system]],{{Cite web |date=2023-08-29 |title=华为 Mate 60 Pro 正式开售：首发卫星通话，12+512GB 售价 6999 元 |url=https://www.ithome.com/0/715/482.htm |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230829124609/https://www.ithome.com/0/715/482.htm |archive-date=2023-08-29 |access-date=2023-08-29 |website=IT之家}}{{Cite web |last=Gloria |date=2021-02-17 |title=6G對於半導體以及所有產業來說，將開啟一個新時代和新商機 |url=http://iknow.stpi.narl.org.tw/Post/Read.aspx?PostID=17510 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230831225101/https://iknow.stpi.narl.org.tw/Post/Read.aspx?PostID=17510 |archive-date=2023-08-31 |access-date=2023-08-31 |website=iKnow科技產業資訊室}}{{Cite web |last=Li |first=Deng |date=2023-08-29 |title=Huawei Mate 60 Pro satellite calling costs 100 yuan ($13) for 80 minutes of talktime |url=https://www.huaweicentral.com/huawei-mate-60-pro-satellite-calling-costs-100-yuan-13-for-80-minutes-of-talktime/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230830123155/https://www.huaweicentral.com/huawei-mate-60-pro-satellite-calling-costs-100-yuan-13-for-80-minutes-of-talktime/ |archive-date=2023-08-30 |access-date=2023-08-30 |website=Huawei Central |language=en-US}}{{Cite web |title=为华为Mate 60 Pro提供卫星通话服务，天通卫星系统亮相服贸会 |url=https://news.ycwb.com/2023-09/04/content_52183912.htm |access-date=2023-09-06 |website=news.ycwb.com}} and short message sending and receiving functions through the [[BeiDou|Beidou system]].{{Cite web |title=HUAWEI Mate 60 - 华为官网 |url=https://consumer.huawei.com/cn/phones/mate60/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230830123156/https://consumer.huawei.com/cn/phones/mate60/ |archive-date=2023-08-30 |access-date=2023-08-30 |website=consumer.huawei.com |language=zh-CN}}{{Cite web |last=Lancaster |first=Marco |date=2023-08-31 |title=Huawei Mate 60 is also out with Kirin 9000 and XMAGE Camera Setup |url=https://www.gizchina.com/2023/08/30/huawei-mate-60-is-also-out-with-kirin-9000-and-xmage-camera-setup/ |access-date=2023-09-06 |website=Gizchina.com |language=en-US}} In addition, the Mate 60 series smartphone also supports [[NearLink]], a short-range wireless communication technology that combines the features of [[Bluetooth]] and [[Wi-Fi]] with enhanced prerequisites, and can be used in future on [[Internet of things|Internet of Things]], [[Internet of vehicles|Internet of Vehicles]] and other scenarios.{{cite web |author1=Hamid Ganji |title=Huawei NearLink is here to replace Bluetooth |url=https://www.androidheadlines.com/2023/08/huawei-nearlink-is-here-to-replace-bluetooth.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230831225052/https://www.androidheadlines.com/2023/08/huawei-nearlink-is-here-to-replace-bluetooth.html |archive-date=2023-08-31 |accessdate=2023-08-09 |website=Android Headlines |date=9 August 2023 |url-status=live}}{{Cite web |last=經濟日報 |title=華為黑科技星閃技術將取代藍牙？ {{!}} 大陸政經 {{!}} 兩岸 |url=https://money.udn.com/money/story/5603/7450984 |access-date=2023-09-20 |website=經濟日報 |language=zh-Hant-TW}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [https://consumer.huawei.com/cn/phones/mate60/ HUAWEI Mate 60 official website] * [https://consumer.huawei.com/cn/phones/mate60-pro/ HUAWEI Mate 60 Pro official website] * [https://consumer.huawei.com/cn/phones/mate60-pro-plus/ HUAWEI Mate 60 Pro+ official website] {{Huawei}} rear cameras]] [[Category:Mobile phones with 4K video recording]] {{cellphone-stub}}
